instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v no power <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> had problems
threads.message:
Previews shop ripped DB554 and DB549 and its pads (port on right side of mac), customer wants information so fixing that is secondary.

<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> was 1.7 and after looking around I found <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> had a tiny bit of corrosion under the corner, after replacing <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> came back to normal, but still not butting, I replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> just in case and nothing either.

Reviving T2 in both Catalina and Big Sur gives me error: "Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU state.  [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFA5 (4005)]"

All awake voltages are present.
PPBUS 12.6V
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> 2.5V
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> 0.9V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> 1.8V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v no power <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> had problems
threads.message: Very likely damaged SSD; got overvoltage from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (corroded <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>).
